title: 2025 NFL Week 17: Hart‚Äôs Picks
description: Mile High Report‚Äôs Christopher Hart gives his picks for Week 17 of the 2025 NFL regular season.
fullText:
Week 17 of the NFL regular season is upon us. Only two more weeks of regular season picks are left. My Week 16 picks were not optimal. I picked just 9 of 16 games correctly. Through fifteen weeks I‚Äôm now sitting at 160-80 with predictions. Let‚Äôs see if I can do better than I did last week.

Christmas Day (Early Game) ‚ÄîDallas Cowboys at Washington Commanders

Had events played out differently in the regular season, this game could have been garnered huge playoff implications. Unfortunately, these NFC East rivals are both eliminated from playoff contention. I think the Cowboys end up winning this one on the road.

Christmas Day (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Detroit Lions at Minnesota Vikings

The only way the Lions can make the playoffs is by winning out and the Packers losing their final two games. It‚Äôs a longshot, but stranger things have happened. Not that he has been great, but J.J. McCarthy won‚Äôt be playing in this one. That being said, I think Detroit will win this one easily.

Christmas Day (Night Game) ‚Äî Denver Broncos at Kansas City Chiefs

The Broncos lost to the Jacksonville Jaguars last Sunday. Denver still controls their own destiny and can earn the AFC‚Äôs top seed if they beat the Chiefs and Chargers the next two weeks. They‚Äôve got a lot of mistakes to clean up, but I have a feeling they will deliver Broncos Country a present on Christmas night and beat Kansas City.

Saturday Football (Afternoon Game) ‚Äî Houston Texans at Los Angeles Chargers

Both the Texans and Chargers are poised to make the postseason. The only question is will it be as a wildcard team or division champion. The stakes are huge for both of them. Houston‚Äôs defense has been the strength of their team and Justin Herbert has impressed despite numerous key losses to their offensive line. All things considered, I think DeMeco Ryans has his team ready to win this one.

DeMeco Ryans on the game vs the Chargers:

‚ÄúNo doubt about it. It‚Äôs defintley a playoff game. It was a playoff game for us last week. That‚Äôs where you want to be in December, playing meaningful games & that‚Äôs what this team has earned.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/sRbAg9pofV

‚Äî Houston Stressans (@TexansCommenter) December 23, 2025

Saturday Football (Evening Game) ‚Äî Baltimore Ravens at Green Bay Packers

The Ravens aren‚Äôt out of the playoffs yet, but their chances of making the postseason are slim. Currently, the Packers are the NFC‚Äôs seventh seed and can punch their playoff ticket with a win. With a back contusion suffered in Week 16, there is a good chance Lamar Jackson doesn‚Äôt play. If so, that should make the Packers heavy favorites in this one. I‚Äôm taking Green Bay at home.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Arizona Cardinals at Cincinnati Bengals

This Sunday game is an uninteresting matchup with two teams out of playoff contention. After laying a goose egg a few weeks ago, the Bengals kicked things into high gear last weekend and scored a lot of points. I think they will do the same on Sunday, as the Cardinals are in a tailspin having lost seven games in a row. I‚Äôm picking Cincinnati.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Pittsburgh Steelers at Cleveland Browns

The formula is simple for the Steelers to make the postseason. A win over the Browns guarantees them the AFC North title and the opportunity to host a Wild Card round playoff game. Could the Browns play spoiler? Sure, but don‚Äôt count on that. I‚Äôm confident that Pittsburgh takes care of business here.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî New Orleans Saints at Tennessee Titans

The Saints have won three in a row and are now 5-10 on the season. Meanwhile, the Titans are a 3-12 team coming off a victory against the Chiefs in Week 16. There isn‚Äôt anything compelling about this matchup to really write about. That being said, I‚Äôll take New Orleans on the road.

THREE IN A ROW DUBS#Saints | @Gatorade pic.twitter.com/br2Fm49xjA

‚Äî New Orleans Saints (@Saints) December 21, 2025

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Jacksonville Jaguars at Indianapolis Colts

The Jaguars earned a playoff berth defeating the Broncos last weekend. They have a path to the AFC‚Äôs top seed, though it will take some help. In order for that to happen, beating the Colts who have dropped five games in a row is a must. Based on what I saw against Denver last Sunday, I like their chances against Indianapolis.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Miami Dolphins

The Buccaneers started off the season hot but have dropped three games in a row. They have to win this game, and the Panthers need to lose against the Seahawks in order to keep their postseason hopes alive. I‚Äôm expecting both of those things to happen, with the Week 18 Buccaneers/Panthers matchup deciding who wins the NFC South.

Sunday Football (Late Game) ‚Äî New England Patriots at New York Jets

The Patriots have a path to the top seed in the AFC. In order for that potentiality to become reality, finding a way to beat the Jets on the road needs to take place. I have no concerns about their ability to do so. I don‚Äôt think this game will be close at all. I‚Äôve got New England winning on the road in a landslide.

Sunday Football (Early Game) ‚Äî Seattle Seahawks at Carolina Panthers

The Seahawks defied the odds and rallied late to defeat the Rams in Week 16, whilst the Panthers were able to defeat Tampa Bay. Both these teams want this game. Seattle winning would pretty much assure them the top seed in the NFC. A Panthers win would give them a shot at the NFC South title if the Buccaneers wind up losing. A lot is at stake in this one, but I think Seattle gets a huge road win.

The Rams would be eliminated from both the #1 seed and NFC West title race if the Seahawks beat the Panthers and the 49ers beat the Bears in Week 17. pic.twitter.com/5H1p6Zi0Ba

‚Äî Brian Nemhauser (@hawkblogger) December 23, 2025

Sunday Football (Late Game) ‚Äî New York Giants at Las Vegas Raiders

Sporting 2-13 records, the Giants and Raiders are the worst teams in their respective conferences. The loser of this game will have the upper hand relative to earning the #1 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft. But maybe something crazy happens and it ends in a tie. Who knows? I don‚Äôt really care. I‚Äôll just pick the Giants for the heck of it.

Sunday Football (Late Game) ‚Äî Philadelphia Eagles at Buffalo Bills

Both the Eagles and Bills have clinched playoff berths. Philadelphia won the NFC East and will get to host a playoff game. The Bills aren‚Äôt out of the AFC East race yet but need some help for that to happen. I ultimately expect the Patriots to take that division. Even so, I think the Bills beat the Eagles. It should be a fun matchup either way.

Sunday Night Football ‚Äî Chicago Bears at San Francisco 49ers

Boasting 11-4 records, the Bears and 49ers are also in the postseason. Each team has a slim path to the top seed in the NFC. What both of them have accomplished this year is impressive. I certainly didn‚Äôt have either of them securing 11 wins this season. This might be the most fun matchup of Week 17 and should be a great primetime game for all football fans to enjoy. I‚Äôm taking the 49ers in this one.

Monday Night Football ‚Äî Los Angeles Rams at Atlanta Falcons

The Rams definitely need to find a way to win this game after being stunned by the Seahawks in Week 16. Dropping that game plummeted their chances of being the NFC‚Äôs top seed. I‚Äôve got Los Angeles winning this one. And guess what? A victory will make the first-round pick they get from Atlanta better in the ‚Äò26 NFL Draft.

title: Kyle Long explains his role on Netflix's NFL Christmas Gameday
description: During his chat with @EdEastonJr, retired All-Pro Kyle Long explained his role on Netflix's NFL Christmas Gameday
fullText:
This week, Chiefs Wire's Ed Easton Jr. spoke with retired All-Pro offensive lineman and CBS Sports analyst Kyle Long.

In his interview with Easton Jr., Long discussed his role as a remote analyst for NFL Christmas Gameday on Netflix today.

"I will be on the desk with Scott Hanson in Los Angeles, and it'll go out to the rest of the world. Obviously, many people will be watching on Netflix. Every single time you see one of those guys run on the field with the orange gloves and say, TV timeout, or the players get a breather, they'll throw it back to the studio," said Long, "Scott and I will be covering all the happenings from that drive, looking ahead, all the storylines you could think of. Obviously, as people watch, they will try to interact. We'll have multiple opportunities to engage in back-and-forth with people around the world. It's a dream come true for me; Christmas and football are always synonymous, just as Thanksgiving is. Nobody does it like Netflix."

NFL CHRISTMAS GAMEDAY
LIVE on Netflix December 25
-- 
Cowboys vs. Commanders @ 1 PM ET
Lions vs. Vikings @ 4:30 PM ET

‚Äî Netflix (@netflix) December 4, 2025

Long, a former Kansas City Chiefs player, discussed the Detroit Lions-Minnesota Vikings matchup, which carries postseason implications for Detroit in the NFC North.

"You've got to keep in mind this Lions team, they went from winless to the bullies to now, you know, middle of the pack, and I think it's almost poetic, because I feel like a Dan Campbell team is not supposed to be at the top of the heap," said Long, "They're supposed to be scratching and clawing their way in. I believe this aligns with the 'MO' (Main Objective) in Detroit. We've got to earn it. We've got to scratch and claw."

Kansas City notably defeated Detroit earlier this season in Week 6 at Arrowhead Stadium, while the Vikings will play spoiler as hosts of the second game of the doubleheader.

"The Minnesota Vikings. I mean, I don't know if you're on social media, but there's been a lot of memes about the Minnesota Vikings, particularly their young quarterback, and what I've seen is that the defense has rallied around this guy. "The protectors on the offensive side rally around this guy," said Long. "You take a look around the NFC North, and the Bears and the Packers are the two teams most likely to make the playoffs. These two teams are fighting for respect, and they know that next year starts now, especially for a guy like J.J. McCarthy. We know how good their coach is. We know about their defense, but the one big question mark is that quarterback. So we're going to find out more about that on Christmas."

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Kyle Long explains his role on Netflix's NFL Christmas Gameday

title: NFL execs weigh in on Coach of the Year award and Jaguars' Liam Coen
description: Numerous NFL execs recently weighed in on the 2025 Coach of the Year award and the Jaguars' Liam Coen.
fullText:
NFL execs recently weighed in on who they believe should be the NFL's Coach of the Year, and among those mentioned was the Jacksonville Jaguars' Liam Coen.

The NFL Network's Tom Pelissero polled 30 execs, asking them to vote on who they believe should win each major end-of-season award, such as MVP, Coach of the Year, and others.

When it came to Coach of the Year, New England's Mike Vrabel was the clear-cut winner if it were up to the NFL execs. He received 13 votes.

Chicago's Ben Johnson was second with six votes, while Coen was third with four votes.

Under Coen, the Jaguars have made one of the biggest turnarounds in football, going from four wins a season ago to 11 wins with still two games left in the regular season.

Jacksonville has clinched a playoff spot, but they also still find themselves in the mix for the AFC's No. 1 seed.

Trevor Lawrence is playing some of the best football of his career over the last month under Coen. The offense has scored 30-plus points in five of their last eight games as well.

Not to be overlooked either is the staff that Coen has assembled around him, which includes offensive coordinator Grant Udinski and defensive coordinator Anthony Campanile, who has turned the Jaguars into a takeaway-heavy defense.

However, perhaps what stands out the most about this Coen-led Jaguars team is their resiliency.

After blowing a 19-point fourth-quarter lead to Houston, the Jaguars were 5-4, and it felt like a fork in the road moment for this team. But since then, Jacksonville has won six games in a row, which tells us a lot about the makeup of this team under Coen's leadership.

This article originally appeared on Jaguars Wire: NFL execs put Jaguars Liam Coen in Coach of the Year conversation

title: Why AFC's 'three-headed monster' is set to miss NFL play-offs
description: The NFL post-season may be without Patrick Mahomes, Lamar Jackson and Joe Burrow, but what went wrong for the star quarterbacks, and who is most likely to bounce back?
fullText:
The Kansas City Chiefs are out of contention for this season's NFL play-offs and so too are their conference rivals Cincinnati.

I just don't see the Baltimore Ravens getting in either. They need to win their last two games to have a chance, so in terms of quarterbacks, that would be a three-headed monster missing from the AFC - Lamar Jackson, Joe Burrow and Patrick Mahomes.

All three having injuries this season is just wild, and Jackson went off with another in Sunday's loss to New England. He's already missed three games and in each of the past six weeks has missed at least one day of practice.

I don't think he's ever fully recovered from the main hamstring injured he had. There was one game where it was like "hey, he's back. He's moving like the Lamar Jackson that we're used to".

But if you look at his other injuries - toe, ankle, knee, and now his back - I feel like he's a bit more fragile at the moment, after all the hits he's taken. He's had injuries adding up over the years, so is his style of play sustainable?

I really hope his Super Bowl window hasn't closed because he's so wonderful to watch.

I just think there needs to be a bit of a shake-up at Baltimore because there were some odd moments in Sunday's game, with the play calling and top players making big mistakes in big moments. At the end of the season, someone's got to take responsibility.

The two main things they've struggled with is Lamar not being healthy and having zero pass rush. I just don't understand it - defensive tackle Nnamdi Madubuike went down early in the season, so why you wouldn't find an impact player from a pass-rush perspective?

The Ravens used to have this attitude. Teams used to be scared of that pass rush, that defensive line, and they've kind of lost that.

It's the same with the Bengals and Chiefs. Although you keep winning, and that means you don't have high draft picks, you've got to be able to build depth in those moments.

If you're investing on one side of the ball, you've got to draft on the other side. You've got to find ways to strengthen an already elite team - the team that's done it best is the Philadelphia Eagles and their general manager Howie Roseman.

title: Bears kicker Cairo Santos named NFC Special Teams Player of the Week
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill. (WGN) ‚Äî While Caleb Williams, DJ Moore and the Chicago Bears‚Äô offense received most of the praise for last weekend‚Äôs dramatic, come-from-behind victory over the Green Bay Packers, it would have never happened had it not been for kicker Cairo Santos. In a press release on Wednesday, the NFL announced Santos was [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
LAKE FOREST, Ill. (WGN) ‚Äî While Caleb Williams, DJ Moore and the Chicago Bears‚Äô offense received most of the praise for last weekend‚Äôs dramatic, come-from-behind victory over the Green Bay Packers, it would have never happened had it not been for kicker Cairo Santos.

In a press release on Wednesday, the NFL announced Santos was named NFC Special Teams Player of the Week for Week 16 after his efforts in the Bears‚Äô 22-16 overtime win versus the Packers.

How improbable was the Chicago Bears‚Äô OT win over the Green Bay Packers?

‚ÄúCairo navigating the wind ‚Ä¶ It was just unbelievable with the gusty conditions out there. You guys saw all of the paper cups and all of the things flying and floating all over the field,‚Äù Special Teams Coordinator Richard Hightower said. ‚ÄúFor him to have the mental fortitude to stay focused and play the conditions is what we talk about doing.

‚ÄúNot trying to beat the conditions, not being upset about the conditions, but play the conditions. I thought he did an excellent job of that and struck the ball really well ‚Ä¶ It helped us a ton.‚Äù

Santos converted all three of his field goal attempts in a driving wind‚Äîfrom 46, 51 and 43 yards‚Äîand his lone point-after attempt. He was also the only NFC kicker to score at least 10 points and make 100% of his kicks, including one from 50 yards or longer.

‚ÄúIt was super gusty. It was a tough day today,‚Äù Santos said after the game. ‚ÄúMy first 46-yarder was against the wind, and all the other ones were with the wind. IN the fourth quarter, we were kicking with the wind, but it was more of a crosswind. So, we just had to play a perfect ball and trust it.‚Äù

According to the National Weather Service, wind gusts reached as high as 25-30 mph on Saturday at Soldier Field.

On top of his ten points scored, he also helped Chicago‚Äôs special teams unit recover an onside kick with 1:59 remaining in regulation against Green Bay.

‚ÄúCairo‚Äôs done so much work on campus here, and he‚Äôs done it in the offseason too‚ÄîI‚Äôm talking about all different types of kicks,‚Äù Hightower said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve tried to stop him at times from kicking onside kicks so much, like, ‚ÄòHey, it‚Äôs time to go in.‚Äô And he keeps doing it. There‚Äôs so much work that‚Äôs been put in from that standpoint that it‚Äôs not an accident.

‚ÄúHe put work in for it and he hit a really good ball.‚Äù

His one make from 50+, a 51-yarder in the fourth quarter, was his 25th made field goal of 50-plus yards as a member of the Bears, the most by any kicker in franchise history.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have many words, man. It‚Äôs special to do this with you guys‚Äîcoaches, players,‚Äù Santos said after receiving a game ball from Ben Johnson in the postgame locker room.

Over the last two seasons, under Special Teams Coordinator¬†Richard Hightower, the Bears have earned five¬†Special Teams Player of the Week¬†awards, tied with the Denver Broncos for the most in the NFL.

title: Steelers‚Äô Mike Tomlin Earns Lofty Praise From Former Rival
description: Mike Tomlin and Mike McCarthy are two of the most successful NFL head coaches of this century. Both won a Super Bowl, while Tomlin has 200 career wins and counting and McCarthy has 185. McCarthy even won his Super Bowl at Tomlin‚Äôs expense in early 2011, with his Green Bay Packers edging the Pittsburgh Steelers [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Mike Tomlin and Mike McCarthy are two of the most successful NFL head coaches of this century. Both won a Super Bowl, while Tomlin has 200 career wins and counting and McCarthy has 185.

McCarthy even won his Super Bowl at Tomlin‚Äôs expense in early 2011, with his Green Bay Packers edging the Pittsburgh Steelers 31-25 in Super Bowl XLV as Aaron Rodgers outdueled Ben Roethlisberger.

Neither team has been back to the Super Bowl since, although Rodgers and Tomlin have a chance to get there this year in a wide-open AFC.

With Tomlin notching his 200th career win last week and extending his historic streak of seasons without a losing record to 19, McCarthy praised his former rival on Wednesday‚Äôs episode of ‚ÄúThe Pat McAfee Show.‚Äù

"I'm so happy to see Mike Tomlin get the recognition that he deserves..

He's a Hall of Famer and what he's done in Pittsburgh is incredible" ~ Coach McCarthy #PMSLive pic.twitter.com/4SD7UCjZON

‚Äî Pat McAfee (@PatMcAfeeShow) December 24, 2025

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so happy to see Mike get the recognition and love that he deserves,‚Äù McCarthy said. ‚ÄúThis, to me, is the reality of who he is as a coach. To do that for 19 seasons is incredible. You want that in your leader‚Ä¶He‚Äôs a Hall of Famer in my view, and I‚Äôm just really happy for him to see him recognized properly.‚Äù

Tomlin has received a good amount of praise and respect over the last few days just weeks after many fans and media members were calling for the Steelers to fire him. Such is life in the NFL.

The veteran coach has helped turn his team around and get them back on track after a midseason swoon that nearly derailed their playoff hopes. They‚Äôve won three straight games, playing their best football during the biggest games of the year.

If Pittsburgh keeps it up, Tomlin has a good chance to earn his first playoff win in nearly a decade next month.

More Steelers: Mike McCarthy Reveals Steelers-Themed Christmas Wish

The post Steelers‚Äô Mike Tomlin Earns Lofty Praise From Former Rival appeared first on SportsNet Pittsburgh.

title: Jerry Jones Hints at Cowboys International Game Coming 'Next Year'
description: The NFL is expecting each team to compete in an international game on a rotational basis. The Dallas Cowboys are due to appear in one, and it could come much sooner than later.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have not appeared in an international game since 2014, which is the longest active streak among any NFL franchise.

With the league now proposing that each team take part in a game on foreign soil at least once every eight years, the Cowboys are next in line to book a trip out of the country for a game. The new rule came about in 2022, so no agreements have been broken yet, but the Cowboys' worldwide fame is a bit surprising that no international exposure has been scheduled yet.

In 2014, it was Tony Romo and Dez Bryant who led a Cowboys team to a 31-17 win in London over the Jacksonville Jaguars. It was the franchise's first and only game played outside of the United States.

Cowboys owner Jerry Jones not only thinks Dallas' next international game is approaching, but that it could be south of the border as soon as next season. The NFL is already planning to host a game next season at Estadio Azeteca in Mexico City in 2026.

‚ÄúI think probably in the near time,‚Äù Jones said about the idea, ‚Äúwith near being next year.‚Äù

We've already looked at the Cowboys' potential 2026 schedule based on them being locked into the No. 2 placing in the NFC East. Dallas is scheduled to host nine games at AT&T Stadium and travel to eight road games.

One of those home contests would have to be sacrificed for an international game. If it comes in Mexico City, we figure that'd be as close to a home-like crowd as you can find outside of Arlington.

Whether it's in North America or Europe, the general expectation is for Dallas to be the home team in this one because they've been voided of the opportunity as a visitor in the past. Home teams in these games get to choose their opponent, and many are smart not to pick a team with such a large fanbase and global brand like the Cowboys with the risk of losing merchandising sales or in-stadium support.

According to ClutchPoints, Jones says that Dallas being the home team in order to score a game is "unavoidable under the current framework," because it's also they will have to rotationally give up a home game and compete internationally anyway.

With this in mind, don't be surprised if "America's Team" takes on foreign soil in the near future.

title: Fan involved in sideline incident with Steelers' DK Metcalf 'remains under review' by NFL
description: Metcalf was suspended two games by the league for his involvement
fullText:
The NFL and the Detroit Lions are continuing to investigate the situation involving a fan and Pittsburgh Steelers receiver DK Metcalf that happened during Sunday's game at Ford Field.

According to ESPN's Adam Schefter, the league is interested in pursuing the matter following information provided to them by Metcalf during Tuesday's appeal hearing for his two-game suspension. The investigation will focus on if the fan violated the Lions' guest code of conduct.

Here is the Lions fan code of conduct. The team found no violation and does not plan to action against the fan, who identified himself to the @freep as Ryan Kennedy. But the NFL is now following up with the team after hearing from DK Metcalf and others in his appeal hearing. pic.twitter.com/H4nyqbLX1K

‚Äî Tom Pelissero (@TomPelissero) December 24, 2025

‚ÄúThe matter remains under review,‚Äù an NFL spokesman told the Pittsburgh Tribune-Review in an email.

Metcalf's two-game suspension was upheld, the league announced Tuesday evening, ending his regular season.

The incident occurred in the second quarter of Sunday's game. While the Lions' offense was on the field, Metcalf approached a fan sitting in the front row and wearing a blue wig. After exchanging words with the fan, Metcalf appeared to throw a punch at the fan's head.

While the incident was captured on the broadcast, it was not seen by officials.

DK Metcalf appears to have an altercation with a Detroit fan pic.twitter.com/a478Zjg3tR

‚Äî NFL on CBS üèà (@NFLonCBS) December 21, 2025

Because of that, Metcalf was not penalized and was not ejected from the contest.

The fan claimed Metcalf threw a punch because the fan taunted the wideout with his full name, DeKaylin Zecharius.

On Monday, however, sources told Tom Pelissero of NFL Network that the fan used a derogatory term when taunting Metcalf about his mother. That source also claimed the fan called Metcalf "something we both know you don't call a Black man."

The fan's attorney released a statement Monday calling the allegations against the fan, Ryan Kennedy, "completely false."

"Ryan Kennedy categorically denies using the 'N-word,' the 'C-word,' or any racial, misogynistic, or hate-based slur during the incident that occurred on December 21, 2025 at Ford Field during the Pittsburgh Steelers-Detroit Lions game.

"These allegations are completely false."

During his Tuesday news conference, Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin said that although he doesn't condone Metcalf's actions, he supports the wide receiver.

‚ÄúHe did explain to me why he did what he did, and I certainly don‚Äôt condone the behavior, but I support DK," Tomlin said. "And I really don‚Äôt have a lot to add other than what I just told you."

Kennedy was escorted from his seat but not ejected from the stadium. The Lions told The Athletic on Tuesday that the team did not plan to take action against Kennedy.

The Steelers finish the regular season against the Cleveland Browns this Sunday and the Baltimore Ravens in Week 18. Pittsburgh can wrap up the AFC North title this week by beating Cleveland or with a loss by the Ravens to the Green Bay Packers.

title: Arizona Cardinals mock draft. Predictions for first 10 picks
description: The Arizona Cardinals need a quarterback this offseason. The question is whether they'll be able to find one in the first round of the NFL draft.
fullText:
How have we gotten here? This Arizona Cardinals‚Äô season was supposed to lead to the playoffs. At the very least, it was supposed to lead to contention. Christmas week should have been about setting the stage for a heavyweight showdown with the Cincinnati Bengals.

Instead, the Bengals are 5-10 and the Cardinals are somehow even worse, at 3-12.

So now, that familiar time of year has arrived, far earlier than anyone had hoped. It‚Äôs mock draft season.

This year‚Äôs draft class is widely considered to be a thin group, but that‚Äôs OK for the Cardinals. They currently hold the No. 6 pick. The big question, though, is where they‚Äôll be able to find their quarterback of the future.

So for the first time, here are our top 10 projected picks of the 2026 NFL Draft. As always, this mock draft is without trades.

If the Giants do ultimately end up with the No. 1 pick, a trade becomes highly likely. New York already has a promising young quarterback, Jaxson Dart, while the rest of the top 10 is packed with quarterback-needy teams ‚Äî including the Cardinals, of course.

Would Arizona pony up the package required for the top selection? That‚Äôs a question for general manager Monti Ossenfort and, potentially, head coach Jonathan Gannon, if he retains his job. But it might be the best path to a quarterback, given the teams currently ahead of them.

If the Giants beat the Raiders this week, though, Las Vegas will jump into the No. 1 spot. Unlike the Giants, the Raiders desperately need quarterback help and would not likely trade the pick.

As for Reese, he could be the top non-quarterback off the board, as a versatile, explosive player who can line up off the edge or at linebacker. It‚Äôs just unlikely it will actually be at the No. 1 pick after trades.

Mendoza, this year‚Äôs Heisman Trophy winner, is noted for his elite football intelligence and ability to play on-time within an offense. If this Cardinals‚Äô coaching staff remains in place, that will be an appealing proposition, given that they preferred Jacoby Brissett to Kyler Murray for those reasons. The problem will be getting a high enough draft pick to secure Mendoza, who is the betting favorite for the top pick.

Some expect Moore to remain in school, as he has made just 18 career starts and could earn a nice NIL payday if he returned to Oregon. But as his draft stock climbs, so too do his chances of declaring. That would be a major boost for the Cardinals, who need as many quarterbacks as possible in this class to help their chances of finding one. On the field, Moore stands out with his accuracy and creativity as a passer.

As has been the case for most of the past five decades, the Jets need a quarterback this spring. But if they end up behind the Raiders and Browns, that might require a trade up. Fortunately for New York, they have five first-round picks over the next two years ‚Äî ammunition that the Cardinals can‚Äôt match.

As for Bain, he‚Äôs a powerful edge rusher who just notched three sacks against Texas A&M in the College Football Playoff. He could be the first defensive player off the board.

Unlike the quarterback-needy teams around them, the Titans are in a great spot. Their top offseason priority will be finding talent to help support Cam Ward. And no matter where they end up, they should be able to draft either Tate or Jordyn Tyson, the top two wide receivers.

So, this is the Cardinals‚Äô conundrum. Only two quarterbacks are currently seen as top-five picks, and one of them might stay in college.

Trading up would be expensive, especially for a team that has holes all over its roster. Ty Simpson ‚Äî the potential third quarterback off the board ‚Äî would be a reach. There are few good options, unless their pick moves up over the next two weeks.

All of that could leave the Cardinals looking to another position. That‚Äôs where Fano comes in. He‚Äôs an athletic player who is widely considered the top tackle in the class. Pairing him with Paris Johnson Jr. would give the Cardinals their tackle duo of the future and boost an offensive line that has struggled in 2025.

Purely from a talent perspective, Love might be the best player in this class. But as with Ashton Jeanty last year, the issue is positional value. Washington would be passing up on much-needed defensive help to draft Love.

Still, the idea is tantalizing: a hyper-talented running back to pair with Jayden Daniels. That would give Washington one of the league‚Äôs most dangerous rushing attacks and reduce the need for Daniels to play hero ball, potentially helping him stay healthier.

Tyler Shough has been a pleasant late-season surprise, removing the Saints from the list of teams that need quarterback help. Drafting Tyson to pair with Chris Olave would suddenly create the potential for an exciting offense in New Orleans.

While a homecoming with Tyson might be enticing for local fans ‚Äî especially after missing out on Cam Skattebo last year ‚Äî the fit doesn‚Äôt make much sense for the Cardinals. Wide receiver is one of their few positions of strength.

In many ways, Downs is the Jeremiyah Love of the defensive side ‚Äî an elite talent at a non-premium position. The Bengals, though, need all the help they can get on defense, no matter where it comes. Downs would be a nice fit.

Simpson is the wild card of this quarterback class. He could return to college, with only one year of starting experience under his belt. He could also slip to the back of the first round, due to both his lack of his experience and his struggles late in the season. Or teams could be wooed by his processing ability and early-season tape, shooting him up draft boards. All three options are on the table for now.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Early Arizona Cardinals 2026 NFL mock draft

title: What NFL games are on Christmas Day in 2025? Full TV schedule, times, channels, live streams for holiday matchups
description: All you need to know to watch NFL games on Christmas in 2025.
fullText:
What NFL games are on Christmas Day in 2025? Full TV schedule, times, channels, live streams for holiday matchups originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

On Christmas Day one year ago, the Kansas City Chiefs won their 15th game of the season and locked up a first-round bye. Oh, how times have changed.

The Chiefs are one of six teams playing on Christmas this season, as they cap the holiday by hosting the Denver Broncos, but the shoe is on the other foot this time. It's the Broncos who are competing for the No. 1 seed in the AFC, while the Chiefs are already eliminated from playoff contention and will see their season end before the playoffs for the first time in the Patrick Mahomes era.

Mahomes won't be involved in Kansas City's Christmas game, as he suffered a torn ACL against the Los Angeles Chargers in Week 15. The injury came as the Chiefs were already staring down elimination, but it added another level of devastation to a shell-shocked organization.

Before the Chiefs and Broncos kick off on Christmas night, a pair of games between NFC teams will get the day started as the NFL's footprint on the holiday continues to expand.

Here's what you need to know to watch NFL games on Christmas Day, including live streaming information.

The NFL's Christmas Day tripleheader begins with a couple of matchups sometimes seen on Thanksgiving, albeit in different buildings.

The Washington Commanders play host to the Dallas Cowboys as both teams try to pick up the pieces and build some momentum to close out the season, while the Minnesota Vikings will aim to do the same against the Detroit Lions as J.J. McCarthy tries to prove he should enter 2026 as the team's starting quarterback.

In the nightcap, the Chiefs host the Broncos in a game that once looked like it might decide the AFC West but now only impacts the Broncos as they try to earn a first-round bye in the AFC.

Live stream:¬†Netflix, Amazon Prime Video

The first games of the Christmas Day tripleheader will be broadcast on Netflix, with the third and final contest airing on Amazon Prime Video.

Ian Eagle (play-by-play), Nate Burleson and Matt Ryan will be on the call from Northwest Stadium for Cowboys vs. Commanders, while Noah Eagle (play-by-play) will make it a family affair as he calls Lions vs. Vikings alongside Drew Brees.

Al Michaels and Kirk Herbstreit will call Broncos vs. Chiefs in prime-time on their typical broadcast home of Amazon Prime Video.

fullText:
What time is the Chiefs vs. Broncos Christmas game? Channel, schedule, live stream to watch NFL originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Denver Broncos will travel to Arrowhead to face the Kansas City Chiefs on the evening of Christmas.

This game at the beginning of the season was sure to be the final gift of the holidays. Now that the Chiefs are eliminated from the playoffs¬†and Patrick Mahomes is out indefinitely, there isn't much excitement left.

title: Kelce's last dance? Why Chiefs star could retire from NFL
description: With Kansas City's dynasty over and a wedding to Taylor Swift to plan for, the Chiefs' final two games of the season could be Travis Kelce's last in the NFL.
fullText:
Travis Kelce already has a good idea how tough a decision it is for an NFL player to retire.

Almost two years ago he watched his older brother Jason go through the process.

Travis was sat in the front row of his retirement news conference, wiping away tears as a 36-year-old Jason announced he was ending his 13-year career with the Philadelphia Eagles.

Now Travis is 36 and set to face a similar dilemma as he approaches the end of his 13th year.

After winning three Super Bowls in the past six years with the Kansas City Chiefs, his contract expires at the end of the season.

Having failed to reach the play-offs for the first time in 11 years, the Chiefs' kingdom is finally crumbling.

With Kelce also expected to marry his fiancee Taylor Swift next summer, is now the time for one of the NFL's greatest tight ends to call it a day?

title: Vikings claim former Colts backup QB off waivers
description: According to NFL Network‚Äôs Tom Pelissero, the Minnesota Vikings have claimed recently waived Indianapolis Colts backup quarterback Brett Rypien off waivers, with starter J.J. McCarthy (hand) already out this week: Before this past Monday‚Äôs primetime game, the Colts waived Rypien, who had previously been signed to the active roster a week prior to serve as [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
According to NFL Network‚Äôs Tom Pelissero, the Minnesota Vikings have claimed recently waived Indianapolis Colts backup quarterback Brett Rypien off waivers, with starter J.J. McCarthy (hand) already out this week:

Reunion: The Vikings claimed QB Brett Rypien off waivers from Indianapolis. Some added depth with J.J. McCarthy (hand) out this week. pic.twitter.com/Dz1iknCZSL

‚Äî Tom Pelissero (@TomPelissero) December 23, 2025

Before this past Monday‚Äôs primetime game, the Colts waived Rypien, who had previously been signed to the active roster a week prior to serve as the QB3 against Seattle, in order to create a spot for activated veteran starting defensive tackle DeForest Buckner, coming off injured reserve.

It was a little bit surprising that the Colts didn‚Äôt elect to carry Rypien and declare him inactive‚Äîas a possibility as the emergency QB3 during Monday night‚Äôs loss. It‚Äôs not that there was a strong chance he would need to be called upon by any means, but a 44-year-old Philip Rivers is presumably at least a little less durable than the average NFL starter, and especially fresh off his couch and with five years of retirement.

Not to mention, rookie Riley Leonard is just a few weeks removed from a knee injury, who has been serving as the Colts‚Äô QB2 since Rivers‚Äô surprising arrival.

At any rate, Rypien‚Äôs stint with the Colts ends without him appearing in an NFL game. The 29-year-old veteran quarterback was signed to the Indianapolis practice squad in mid-October before his signing and release.

He now reunites with the Vikings, his old squad that he spent last season with and this entire past offseason. However, he has yet to appear in an NFL game Minnesota either. In his 5-year career, he has appeared in 11 games, making 4 starts though.

For the Colts, Rypien was presumably a candidate to return to their practice squad‚Äîshould he clear waivers. However, it appears as though he‚Äôll be taking at least a brief pit stop in Minnesota until McCarthy returns.

title: Why did the NFL suspend DK Metcalf? Steelers WR receives punishment for punching Lions fan
description: The NFL took action against the Steelers' star receiver on Monday after his incident with a Lions fan in Week 16.
fullText:
Why did the NFL suspend DK Metcalf? Steelers WR receives punishment for punching Lions fan originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

During a key matchup between the Detroit Lions and Pittsburgh Steelers on Sunday, DK Metcalf gave the NFL an incident to settle.

The Steelers' star receiver, in his first year with the team as it pursues the AFC North title, was seen swiping at a Lions fan in the stands as he stood on Pittsburgh's sideline at Ford Field.

Because officials didn't see the interaction, which was caught by the CBS broadcast, Metcalf wasn't disciplined in the game ‚Äî but he was considered sure to be hearing from the NFL afterward. On Monday, the NFL announced a suspension for Metcalf that is set to heavily impact the Steelers' final playoff push.

Here's what to know about Metcalf's suspension after the Steelers star was seen hitting a Lions fan in Week 16.

What to know about DK Metcalf getting physical with a spectator

Meet Ryan Kennedy, the fan that DK Metcalf threw a punch at during Lions-Steelers game

On Monday, Tom Pelissero reported that the NFL is suspending Metcalf for two games without pay for his physical confrontation with a Lions fan. Metcalf appeal that ruling, but on Tuesday, the two-game suspension was upheld, per Adam Schefter.

The NFL's statement on the suspension called it "conduct detrimental to the NFL," saying that "Metcalf's actions violate league policy, which specifies that 'players may not enter the stands or otherwise confront fans at any time on game day."

From the NFL on DK Metcalf being suspended two games for his physical confrontation with a fan Sunday. pic.twitter.com/zopnwRAI0A

‚Äî Mike Garafolo (@MikeGarafolo) December 22, 2025

Some level of punishment was expected for Metcalf after Sunday's incident.

Metcalf was not disciplined by the officials for his interaction with a Lions fan on the sideline. However, that was because the referees did not see the interaction.

He appeared to be the one who initiated the physical contact with the fan, which means his situation is unlike that of Lamar Jackson's earlier in 2025, when the Baltimore Ravens quarterback pushed a Bills fan who had slapped his teammate's helmet. In that instance, the NFL did not punish Jackson, as the fan was banned from NFL stadiums and¬†the matter was "addressed by the club," per ESPN.

When a player initiates the physical interaction with a fan, it's typically a different story for the league. Metcalf is now set to miss the Steelers' final two regular-season games; he will also be missing out on $277,777 per game check, per Jonathan Jones.

MORE:What to know about the NFL's personal conduct policy

Metcalf will be eligible to return to the Steelers roster on Monday, Jan. 5, after Week 18 is over.

That means he will miss Pittburgh's final two games of the regular season against the Browns and Ravens.

Here's the moment Metcalf was seen hitting a Lions fan in Sunday's game.

CBS reporter Tracy Wolfson said the fan said something to Metcalf before he swiped at him.

Per ESPN, the¬†Detroit Free Press¬†spoke to the fan in the altercation, and he identified himself as Ryan Kennedy from Pinckney, Michigan. He said he called Metcalf by his full name, DeKaylin Zecharius Metcalf.

"I called him that and then he grabbed me and ripped my shirt," Kennedy told the Free Press, per ESPN. "I'm a little shocked. Like everyone's talking to me. I'm a little rattled, but I just want the Lions to win, baby."

Here's a look at Pittsburgh's remaining schedule.

The Lions fan whom Metcalf punched at Ford Field in Week 16 named Ryan Kennedy.

The¬†Detroit Free Press¬†spoke to Kennedy after the game, and he said he was "a little shocked" by the incident. Kennedy said that the incident occurred because he called Metcalf by his full name, and the Steelers receiver did not like that.

"He doesn‚Äôt like his government name. I called him that and then he grabbed me and ripped my shirt," Kennedy said. "I‚Äôm a little shocked. Like everyone‚Äôs talking to me. I‚Äôm a little rattled, but I just want the Lions to win, baby."

Additionally,¬†NFL Network's Tom Pelissero¬†reported that Kennedy and Metcalf have history. Metcalf reportedly had issues with Kennedy last year when he was with the¬†Seattle Seahawks¬†and reported the fan to security.

After some rumors over Kennedy using hateful language in the incident, the Lions fan released a statement denying that he used any racial or derogatory language to Metcalf in the interaction through his lawyer.

"Ryan Kennedy categorically denies using the "N-word," the "C-word," or any racial, misogynistic, or hate-based slur during the incident that occurred on December 21, 2025 at Ford Field during the Pittsburgh Steelers-Detroit Lions game. These allegations are completely false."

title: Who is the Lions fan that DK Metcalf punched? What to know about Ryan Kennedy and his history with Steelers WR
description: Here is more on the fan that Steelers WR DK Metcalf punched in Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season.
fullText:
Who is the Lions fan that DK Metcalf punched? What to know about Ryan Kennedy and his history with Steelers WR originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Pittsburgh Steelers beat the Detroit Lions in Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season, but it wasn't without controversy.

In the first half, a clip went viral on social media of Pittsburgh wide receiver DK Metcalf appearing to punch a Lions fan in the stands. It was a quick clip, and no context was provided for the interaction at the time, but the video itself looked bad for the pass-catcher.

Metcalf finished out the game because, by the current rule, the NFL can't intervene in a possible player disqualification unless there is a flag. Since the Steelers' offense wasn't even on the field, there were no flags, as the referees weren't even aware it had happened. He was, however, suspended two games by the league, a ruling that was then upheld after an appeal.

While the public may never know exactly what happened to cause Metcalf to react that way, he may have a history with the fan.

Here is more on the Lions fan that Metcalf punched in Week 16.

MORE:¬†DK Metcalf throws punch at fan during Lions-Steelers game

The Lions fan whom Metcalf punched is named Ryan Kennedy.

The Detroit Free Press was able to track him down after the game for his side of the story. He said he was "a little shocked. Like everyone‚Äôs talking to me. I‚Äôm a little rattled, but I just want the Lions to win, baby."

Initially, when asked his name, Kennedy said, "My name is 'Biggest¬†Detroit Lions¬†Fan Ever that got attacked by DeKaylin Zecharius Metcalf.'"

About the incident, Kennedy said, "He doesn‚Äôt like his government name. I called him that and then he grabbed me and ripped my shirt. I‚Äôm a little shocked. Like everyone‚Äôs talking to me. I‚Äôm a little rattled, but I just want the Lions to win, baby."

Lions officials talked to him, and he was not thrown out of the game.

MORE: Will DK Metcalf be suspended by NFL for punching fan?

The public may never officially know the truth behind what caused the incident. Kennedy told the Detroit Free Press after the game that he called the wide receiver by his legal name, causing the outburst.

Sources told NFL Network's Tom Pelissero that Kennedy and Metcalf have history. Metcalf reportedly had issues with Kennedy last year when he was with the Seattle Seahawks and he reported the fan to stadium security.

Chad Ochocino said on a live stream appearance with Shannon Sharpe that sources told him that the fan called Metcalf a racial slur, and then made derogatory comments about the player's mother, but none of these claims have been confirmed.

Metcalf's real name is DeKaylin Zecharius Metcalf, but he prefers to go by DK.

MORE: Updated AFC, NFC playoff picture in Week 16

After the claims from Ochocinco that Kennedy used racial or derogatory language against Metcalf, the Lions fan, via his lawyer, released a statement denying that report.

The statement reads, "Ryan Kennedy categorically denies using the "N-word," the "C-word," or any racial, misogynistic, or hate-based slur during the incident that occurred on December 21, 2025 at Ford Field during the Pittsburgh Steelers-Detroit Lions game. These allegations are completely false."

Given that the incident is now likely going to be a legal matter, Kennedy had no further comment at this time.

Ryan Kennedy, the fan involved in the DK Metcalf altercation Sunday, has issued a statement through an attorney ‚Äúcategorically denying using the ‚ÄúN-word,‚Äù the ‚ÄúC-word,‚Äù or any racial, misogynistic, or hate-based slur during the incident.

‚ÄúThese allegations are completely false.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/pQUbBYa0ww

#Steelers WR DK Metcalf upset with a fan‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/eoZJjIiXHw

‚Äî Ari Meirov (@MySportsUpdate) December 21, 2025

Here is the clip released later from a different angle.

Another angle of the DK Metcalf incident with a #Lions fan during Sunday‚Äôs game:
